title: Spark-TTS: An Efficient LLM-Based Text-to-Speech Model with Single-Stream Decoupled Speech Tokens
author: Xinsheng Wang (Hong Kong University of Science and Technology), Mingqi Jiang (SparkAudio Open Source Community), Ziyang Ma (Nanyang Technological University), Ziyu Zhang (ASLP@NPU, Northwestern Polytechnical University), Songxiang Liu (Independent Researcher), Linqin Li (Shanghai Mobvoi Information Technology Co., Ltd), Zheng Liang (Shanghai Jiao Tong University), Wei Xue (Hong Kong University of Science and Technology)
relevance_why: The paper presents a novel text-to-speech synthesis system, Spark-TTS, that integrates controllable attributes with high-quality speech generation. This relates to Haohe Liu's research in text-to-audio generation and could inform the development of more refined audio synthesis models.
background: The paper addresses the synthesis of high-quality speech from text using machine learning models, enhancing the ability to control voice attributes like pitch and speed.
contribution: This paper introduces Spark-TTS and BiCodec to solve the limitations of current TTS models in flexibility and complexity, achieving better speech synthesis quality with zero-shot voice cloning.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous TTS methods often relied on complex, multi-stage architectures or lacked adaptive control features for voice synthesis.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work simplifies the architecture with a single-stream BiCodec, enhancing both linguistic fidelity and customizable attribute control.

key_innovation: The use of a single-stream codec that separates linguistic content and speaker attributes allows for enhanced control and ease of integration within existing models.
real_world_impact: This research has significant potential to improve personalized voice synthesis applications, such as virtual assistants or entertainment media, by allowing users to specify voice attributes easily.
limitations: The authors mention limitations in achieving high speaker similarity compared to more complex multi-stage models, which they hope to address in future work.

new_terms.BiCodec: **BiCodec** is a novel tokenization framework that combines low-bitrate semantic tokens with global tokens to enable high-quality, controllable speech synthesis.
new_terms.zero-shot voice cloning: **Zero-shot voice cloning** refers to the ability to duplicate a voice's characteristics without direct training on the specific voice's audio.

open_sourcing: The source code, pre-trained models, and audio samples are available at https://github.com/SparkAudio/Spark-TTS.
